column1: Marginal revenue equals marginal cost at the point where
column2: total revenue is greater than total cost at its greatest distance
column3: total revenue is equal to total cost
column4: marginal product is at its highest point
column5: total product is at its highest point

column1: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of perfectly competitive industry?
column4: Perfectly elastic demand curve.
column5: Homogeneous products.

column1: Which of the following indicates that two goods are complements?
column4: A negative cross-price elasticity
column5: A demand elasticity greater than one

column1: Which of the following is true about the relationship of the average total cost (ATC) curve and the marginal cost (MC) curve?
column2: ATC and MC are always equal.
column3: ATC and MC are never equal.
column4: The ATC curve intersects the MC curve at the minimum point of the MC curve.
column5: The MC curve intersects the ATC curve at the minimum point of the ATC curve.

column1: Price times quantity measures
column4: total revenue.
column5: price elasticity of demand.

column1: Deadweight loss occurs in
column4: oligopoly markets because P > MC.
column5: All of the above.

column1: Which of the following would best complete a short definition of economics? "Economics is the study of . . ."
column2: how unlimited resources are allocated between scarce wants.
column3: how money is circulated through the economy.
column4: how corporations maximize the share price of their stock.
column5: how scarce resources are allocated to satisfy unlimited wants.

column1: Which of the following is not the basis for a wage differential?
column4: Increase in production of SUVs.
column5: Racial discrimination.

column1: Which of the following goods is likely to have the most elastic demand curve?
column4: Demand for Ford automobiles
column5: Demand for American-made automobiles

column1: The market demand curve for labor will shift to the right when
column4: the labor supply curve shifts to the right
column5: the labor supply curve shifts to the left

column1: With the presence of a negative externality, which of the following would internalize (or correct) the externality?
column4: A lower price.
column5: A higher level of output.

column1: The relationship between the marginal revenue curve and the demand curve for a monopoly is most similar to the relationship between the marginal factor cost curve and what curve for a monopsony?
column4: Marginal external cost
column5: Total cost

column1: A monopoly is less efficient than a perfect competitor because
column2: a monopoly produces more output and sells for a higher price
column3: a monopoly produces less output and sells for a higher price
column4: a monopoly can make profit in the short run but not in the long run
column5: a perfect competitor breaks even in the short run and the monopoly does not

column1: When a perfectly competitive labor market is in equilibrium,
column2: everyone who wants to work has the opportunity to do so
column3: individual firms face downward sloping labor demand curves
column4: unemployment can reach as high as 10-15 percent
column5: individual firms face upward sloping labor demand curves

column1: If the perfectly competitive price is currently below minimum average total cost, we can expect which of the following events in the long run?
column2: The price will rise and each firm's output will fall as firms exit the industry.
column3: Market equilibrium quantity will increase as firms exit the industry.
column4: Nothing. The industry is currently in long-run equilibrium.
column5: The price will rise to the breakeven point as firms exit the industry.

column1: An industry described as an oligopoly would most likely have
column2: normal profits in the long run.
column4: significant barriers to entry.
column5: price-taking behavior.

column1: Which of the following examples would result in consumers paying for the largest burden of an excise tax placed on a producer?
column2: If the demand curve is price elastic and the supply curve is price inelastic
column3: If the demand curve is price elastic and the supply curve is perfectly elastic
column4: If the demand curve is price inelastic and the supply curve is price elastic
column5: If the demand curve is perfectly inelastic and the supply curve is price elastic

column1: Which of the following is true about a price ceiling?
column2: It is used to correct government policy.
column3: It is used when equilibrium prices are too low.
column4: It will be located above the equilibrium price.
column5: It will be located below the equilibrium price.

column1: Every time Mr. Hamm makes another pizza in his shop, he places $0.45 worth of sauce on top. For Mr. Hamm, the cost of pizza sauce is a component of which of the following? I. Total Fixed Costs II. Total Variable Costs III. Marginal Cost IV. Total Costs
column4: II and IV only
column5: II, III, and IV only

column1: For a competitive firm, what is the most important thing to consider in deciding whether to shut down in the short run?
column4: Do not produce if the TFC is not covered by revenue.
column5: Produce the highest quantity demanded regardless of price.

column1: Which of the following situations best exemplifies the concept of consumer surplus?
column2: It refers to a consumer who no longer has any outstanding debts.
column3: The federal government has taken in more revenue than it has paid out in expenditures.
column4: A consumer pays more for a pizza than she thought it was worth at the margin of the purchase.
column5: A consumer pays less for a pizza than she thought it was worth at the margin of the purchase.
